channel.title: Health? Maybe a little late
channel.description:
I haven't looked at the client in ages, so I might be a little late here, but is it just me or is their no longer health fields. All I'm pulling up is what appears to be a ratio of sorts that just denominates the level of the health bar itself, but no definitive number. Tell me if I'm wrong here?
Thanks.

item.title: Health? Maybe a little late
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Another thread destroyed by the nerd patrol.

Read full topic

item.title: Health? Maybe a little late
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:14, topic:288955”][quote author=Jython_ link=topic=382010.msg2872632#msg2872632 date=1247858408]
5 posts to do basic algebra… wow. Anyway, hello speedster. Been a long time. On subject, yes, the client no longer stores current HP. Rather, it stores a ratio from 0-30, as qauters pointed out.
[/quote]What was the point of your post?[/quote]

Oh, ignorance.

Read full topic

item.title: Health? Maybe a little late
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

speedster239:

Interesting. Well, in theory this could reduce lag in the client itself since it’s less data to process and the ratio can go right into synthesizing the graphics.

More likely it’s done to save bandwidth and/or to give less info to bots.

Read full topic

item.title: Health? Maybe a little late

you guys know advanced math, great great.

item.title: Health? Maybe a little late
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:1, topic:289082”][quote author=qauters link=topic=382010.msg2870566#msg2870566 date=1247733344]
Nope, Metho D’s is valid because:
(30/MAX_HP)CUR_HP=RATIO
(30/MAX_HP)=RATIOCUR_HP
RATIO/(30/MAX_HP)=RATIO/RATIO*CUR_HP
RATIO/30/MAX_HP=CUR_HP
[/quote]

Wrong.
(30/MAX_HP)CUR_HP=RATIO -> (30/MAX_HP)=RATIOCUR_HP
is not possible.


Just divide both sides by (30/MAX_HP), thereby removing it from the left side and leaving CUR_HP by it’s own.[/quote]
Oops my bad, wasn’t thinking well at that moment I see

Read full topic

item.title: Health? Maybe a little late
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:4, topic:288955”][quote author=qauters link=topic=382010.msg2870078#msg2870078 date=1247699980]
jagex decided it was useless to send the hp to the client, if the server can just calculate it itself ;). So now you have a value between 0 and 30.
(30/MAX_HP)*CUR_HP=RATIO
[/quote]So wouldn’t this be true?

(30 / MAX_HP) / RATIO = CUR_HP[/quote]
Nope, Metho D’s is valid because:
(30/MAX_HP)CUR_HP=RATIO
(30/MAX_HP)=RATIOCUR_HP
RATIO/(30/MAX_HP)=RATIO/RATIO*CUR_HP
RATIO/30/MAX_HP=CUR_HP

Read full topic

item.title: Health? Maybe a little late
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:4, topic:288955”][quote author=qauters link=topic=382010.msg2870078#msg2870078 date=1247699980]
jagex decided it was useless to send the hp to the client, if the server can just calculate it itself ;). So now you have a value between 0 and 30.
(30/MAX_HP)*CUR_HP=RATIO
[/quote]So wouldn’t this be true?

(30 / MAX_HP) / RATIO = CUR_HP[/quote]

No, using qauters’ formula it would be this:

RATIO / (30 / MAX_HP) = CUR_HP

Read full topic
